title: Thanks for the chat ban!
body:
First of all, I know how the Riot system works.  You get banned simply by automated reporting, I had chat bans in the past, and now no longer curse or use any bad language in chats and don't even talk that much.

So my game earlier today, I was support, and ADC trolled pretty hard, he died 2x while still having heal and flash up in early lane, then let me die without using heal as support at around lvl 4.  So i decided he was terrible and I am not going to lane with him anymore, and went to roam the map. then the jungler starts saying "I am going to ban you if you don't goto lane" and the mid laner started telling me to go back bot too "or he will report me."

ANyways, I didn't go back bot, roamed and got some assists top, we end up losing the game, everyone did absolutely terrible in stats, I had one of the least horrible stats at least.  Game was over in about 25 minutes .... and sure enough, I get the chat ban the next game after my team ganged up on me and "report support" for giving up on bot lane.  So, I looked over my chat logs, and there isn't anything offensive at all, I learned from the past about that, nasically the chat logs is just saying that Vayne didn't use heal, died many times and got me killed without using heal, so I won't go back bot and am roaming to help other lanes instead.  Yet, this team ganged up on me, and reported me because they were mad they were terrible and scapegoated me that I left bot lane and roamed.  Now I lost all my honor ranking points.


So, anyways, I wanted to say thank you Riot, I was about to buy some Riot points for my holiday personal shop, and you made that decision pretty clear that I should spend the money elsewhere.  Thank you!

Your automated penalty system is absolutely horrible.

EDIT: The system is very bad, because I am not idea WHY I am chat restricted.  All it says is "negative behavior" and lists some chat logs which is just argument (no personal attacks or racial slur or homophobic or cussing ever).  I got "reported" because my team scapegoated me on this game for losing.

You don't own the CS - nobody owns any CS/farm in League, and you have no right to tell someone to stop, especially repeatedly. You also do not dispute the other two reasons I gave - arguing and being combative/rude towards others. It does not matter if they "started it" - it only matters if you participated in it.

Ganging up to report someone doesn't work. All a report does is flag a game for review, more reports do not weigh against you in any way.

In other words, in a single given game 1 report and 9 reports hold the same power over you. People can not "gang up" to report you.

I am just saying Riot's chat ban and banning system is very terrible, because there aren't clear rules that I have seen on what not to do.  I thought I learned my lesson already from a few years ago, and don't cuss or threaten or do racial/homophobic insults at all.

The purposely make the rules as vague as possible, (just something like, don't be negative or toxic), which essentially is subjective and means your team can scapegoat you and gang up and report you.

Riot makes the system like this, quite simply because it is expensive to actually have real moderation and people to review replays to give real punishment.   So they automated a system poorly with no human interaction, so I can't actually find out what was wrong with my chat log.  Yes, I get it, employees are expensive, however its sacrificing game experience.

The rules are actually pretty darn clear.  This is going to sound crude but it gets the point across; the rules pretty much say don't be an asshole.  Swearing is allowed so long as it's not targeting anyone, and insults will most likely lead to a punishment.  If you don't have anything nice to say just use the mute button and don't type, because that's a quick way to get a chat ban.

The automated review system looks for key words that are most often used by toxic players, and if a player has earned reports over many games but the automated system finds nothing the player is flagged for manual review.  A real person can then look at the games in question for context that a program would not be able to see.

The rules are vague, but ultimately crystal clear in what is and is not allowed, simply because Riot is casting a wide net and want the rules to be easy to read.  If you follow the rule of "don't be an asshole" you'll never get punished.

Just keep in mind that self defense is taking action to prevent harm to your person, where as retaliation, which is against the rule of "don't be an asshole", is all about harming someone else as they have harmed you.  Retaliation is not self defense.

They are generalizations that are supposed to be easy to understand, rather than ending up as ultra-specific legalese.

"Don't be an asshole" doesn't mean don't piss off your team.  Your team can be as angry as they like at you, but if you've done nothing that is against this rule their reports will mean jack shit.

Some people play this game by muting everyone at the very start, and only communicating through pings.  Riot allows this and has said pings are enough communication to get by, so you can do that and just try your best while avoiding anything your team might say.

I cannot physically come up with a simpler way to describe it than "don't be an asshole", so if you're still not getting it hopefully someone else can step in, because I'm out of ideas.

There are very rare cases with false-positives though, so sending in a ticket to player support and asking to be escalated to a player behaviour specialist is an option to find out what part of the chat triggered the chat ban.

As a heads up, early season 8 they will be adding checkpoints to the honour system so that we can track our progress between honour levels.

> 
> In the report I got, it said "other players have reported your comms to be below League Of Legends standards ...", so according directly to Riot's notification to me, its just based other players in my games.

It compares the chat in the logs to the normally reported negative behaviours.
It's also region-sensitive, so if certain forms of toxicity are considered more offensive it'll judge them appropriately.
 
Every reported game it looks through the logs and checks for "negative behaviour" as defined by the summoner's code.
If it finds such behaviour, it attaches the report to the account.
If it finds nothing (false report) it throws the report out and it does nothing.
